notes: Letters to the editor from Doug Moench, Brian Bourgeois, Henry Thompson, Matthew Choate, Richard Morgana, H.J. Cox, Nick H., Joel Gray, Edna Peden, Ty Deise, Bobby Sommerkamp, Donald Markum, Corkey Hucks, Kevin McDonough, Jordan Nash, Clif Rampey, Ron Gillen, Raymond Giordano, David Wing, Tom Szebereny, George Carter, Mitchell Blunt, Craig Littlefield, Randy Helsop, an excerpt of a letter from Clifford Eubons, a note by Richard Margopoulos on his story "Behold the Cybernite" (issue 46), and a photograph of Esteban Maroto.

133.heading: Margopoulos, Rich.
133.title: "Demon in the Cockpit"
133.author: story, Rich Margopoulos ; art, Rich Corben
notes: "Can science and black magic exist together, or must they constantly war?"

135.heading: Margopoulos, Rich.
135.title: Edgar Allan Poe's The Fall of the House of Usher and Other Tales of Horror
135.author: Richard Corben, Richard Margopoulos.

contents.title: The Fall of the House of Usher.

136.heading: Margopoulos, Rich.
136.title: "Ensnared!"
136.author: story, Rich Margopoulos ; art, Alex Toth
notes: "You are anywhere. And then you are in a boxlike room. There is no one there. There is no escape. You're trapped. You hammer at the locked exit and plead, 'Someone let me out!' And then, to your horror, somebody opens the door!"

137.heading: Margopoulos, Rich.
137.title: "Facts in the Case of M. Valdemar"

138.heading: Margopoulos, Rich.
138.title: "The Fall of the House of Usher"

139.heading: Margopoulous, Rich.
139.title: "The Imp of the Perverse!"
139.author: Edgar Allen Poe ; adaptation, Rich Margopoulous ; art, Luis Bermejo
notes: "A wayward spirit haunts humanity. It makes people do wicked, senseless things, simply because they are forbidden. So I trembled, but gleefully. For I was tempted to commit the most fearsome crime of all. Murder!"

140.heading: Margopoulos, Rich.

141.heading: Margopoulos, Rich.
141.title: "Judas"
141.author: story, Rich Margopoulos ; art, Rich Corben
notes: "They came in droves. Indestructible metal conquerors, ready to enslave all of mankind. Only an explosion massive enough to destroy the entire world, could save it!"

151.heading: Margopoulos, Rich.
151.title: "A Touch of Terror"
151.author: story, Rich Margopoulos ; art, Adolfo Abellan
notes: "There are thousands of them and they lurk and wait in the most insidiously innocent of all disguises. Wait to rip, tear, and rend all mortal flesh!"
Cover blurb: "The deadly dolls lived, attacking the man who created them, attacing all humanity!"

Features writers and cartoonists Josey Ballenger, Alison Bechdel, Donna Black, Andrea Carlisle, Catherine Conant, Cathy Crimine, Diane Dimassa, Gyl Elliott, Catherine Goggia, Debra Gussman, Nicole Hollander, Lisa Jansen, Madeleine Begun Kane, Sheryl Kayne, Pamela Margoshes, Jude McGee, Inga Muscio, Sara Nuss-Galles, Effin Older, Nina Paley, Rina Piccolo, Stephanie Piro, Libby Reid, Laura Allen Sandhu, Dorothy Shiels, Nina Silver, Maureen Stanton, Mary-Lou Weisman, and Leslie What.
Women's cartoons.

153.title: Marge, 1904-1993
notes: American cartoonist Marjorie Henderson Buell, who signed her work "Marge". For the comic-book version of her character Little Lulu, see Marge's Little Lulu.
